item.title: Day 81 - photo a day

item.title: Day 80 - photo a day
item.description: Tuesday is gamebuilr sprint retrospective/planning night. Once again we met at Bryamlwg. This time I noticed that they have a Murphy's stout on tap and I'm a big fan of stout. Turns out that it's 30p cheaper than a bottle of beer too!

item.title: Day 75 - photo a day

The appointment with urodynamics was made due to me having issues with fitting the catheters so we decided …

item.title: A visit with Urodynamics
item.description: On Thursday I had an appointment at the Urodynamics department in Bronglais. I actually managed to park in the hospital car park for once (yes, I drove the mile there. You try walking that far in an urban environment with a bladder that gets upset by walking!) so was already …

item.title: Transcambrian Way
item.description:
So this is a ride that's been in my sights for some years now, it's not until recently I've actually acquired the level of fitness necessary to give it a bash though.

What is it?

It's a 104 mile route that snakes across (and a bit up) Wales, starting at …

item.description: A 100km ride has been on the cards for me for a while, it's something that I've really wanted to do. As an aside I've attempted a ride with 2km of elevation a few times and always failed too. A couple of weeks ago I decided to set the May …
item.dc:creator: Charles Dixon

item.title: The Dyfi Enduro
item.description: About that time of year again, sure has gone fast! I was unsure how I was going to ride it this year: see how quick I could get round or just chill out and socialize. I knew that Ben and Steph would taking it at a sociable pace so figured …
item.dc:creator: Charles Dixon

item.title: Photo a Day - Giving up
item.description: I've decided to give up on the photo a day, day 50 seemed like a good milestone to stop at. I wanted to try make each photo have a bit of meaning/story to it and that was starting to become harder and harder, not to mention that I didn't …
item.dc:creator: Charles Dixon

item.title: Day 50 - Photo a Day
item.description: I've managed 50 days! I realised that I haven't yet done a photo of the coaster I got for doing the Dyfi warmup. It feels very worthy of day 50 :).
item.dc:creator: Charles Dixon

item.title: Day 49 - Photo a Day
item.description: This is the view from the kitchen at work, it's not bad at all! Getting ready to take this photo I saw a red kite and two ducks on the little pond that can't be seen in this photo, rad as.
item.dc:creator: Charles Dixon

item.title: Day 48 - Photo a Day
item.description: This is where my place of work is now, the Aberystwyth Science Park! Working for West Coast Software. It's less than a mile from home and takes me a couple of minutes to ride to and from.
item.dc:creator: Charles Dixon

item.title: Day 47 - Photo a Day
item.description: I can't say much about this one really, other than chilblains! They probably won't fall off, they don't normally fall off.
item.dc:creator: Charles Dixon

item.title: Day 46 - Photo a Day
item.description: Been a while since I last made a packed lunch. I made a big roast pork joint today so my lunch tomorrow is pork baps with a bit of cracking and the last cup cake.
item.dc:creator: Charles Dixon

item.title: Day 45 - Photo a Day
item.description: I don't know what it is with these students but today's ride we meet at 9. 9 on a Saturday! We went up Banc y Darren way and I left them at the top of the leg burner to do some different bits. I'd never ridden the Bony Goch climb …
item.dc:creator: Charles Dixon

item.title: Day 44 - Photo a Day
item.description:
Today I decided to go and explore a couple of bridleways up nant, ones I'd not done before.

The first new one linked the highest bit of the mountain road down to the bont goch climb, making more climb before getting to nant. It started off downhill on a double …
item.dc:creator: Charles Dixon

item.title: Day 43 - Photo a Day
item.description: Today Andy and Teesh moved in so I decided to bake cupcakes! They're quite simple vanilla ones as I didn't have loads of stuff, I also made buttercream but it was a really strange recipe and didn't work out well.
item.dc:creator: Charles Dixon

item.title: Day 42 - Photo a Day
item.description: Today I sorted out my spare room so that Andy and Teesh can move in. It'll be nice to have people around the house! Room took some work to get looking remotely presentable and the windows definitely need replacing!
item.dc:creator: Charles Dixon

item.title: Day 41 - Photo a Day
item.description: When I left aber today it was cold and foggy. It continued that way all the way up through Banc y darren but pretty much as soon as I reached the Nant area the clouds parted and the sun came out to play! I stopped at the cafe for a …
item.dc:creator: Charles Dixon

item.title: Day 40 - Photo a Day
item.description: This week I have a week off between jobs so I'll most likely ride bikes a bit. However, today I decided to tackle the ceiling in the shower room. It had ceiling tiles that were going a bit mouldy and starting to peel. I managed to get them off, which …
item.dc:creator: Charles Dixon

item.title: Day 39 - Photo a Day
item.description: Last night (well, yesterday) I made pulled pork ready for us for when we got in from our ride. It was good, we had it with tikka chicken wings, crusty bread and a BBQ sauce that I made. This bowl was just about full yesterday, this is all that is …
item.dc:creator: Charles Dixon

item.title: Day 38 - Photo a Day
item.description: This weekend Rich and Ben are vistiting so today we rode out to Nant via the Bont Goch climb and back down the Ty Cam descent. We had fantastic weather and managed both cake at the VC and beer at the tiddly widdle, good times.
item.dc:creator: Charles Dixon

item.title: Day 37 - Photo a Day
item.description: Well today is my last day of working for Exony/eGain so I thought that I'd take a photo of my work setup before it's gone forever more. The laptop has now been sent back to Exony HQ and goodbye's said. On to new things, which is both scary and …
item.dc:creator: Charles Dixon

item.title: Day 36 - Photo a Day
item.description: This afternoon, given that tomorrow is my last day and that I have no work to do, I went for a ride with a couple of the AberMTB guys. It was a tad chilly and Pendam lake was fully frozen over. The ride was good and the sun was out …
item.dc:creator: Charles Dixon

item.title: Day 35 - Photo a Day
item.description: First off, a note that the next 4 days have all been written on the same day but I can assure you that the photos were taken on the respective days. I might start writing more of the posts on the same day when I get round to it, like …
item.dc:creator: Charles Dixon

item.title: Day 34 - Photo a Day
item.description: I'm bored of trying to find a chain lube that lasts a long ride here in the winter, all of the ones that I've tried just don't work as well as I'd like. I read about people using putolin which is designed for motorbikes, it's a wax that you soak …
item.dc:creator: Charles Dixon

item.title: Day 33 - Photo a Day
item.description: Cut me some slack, I fell off a bike yesterday! Another normal day with nothing exciting to report so it's time for a photo of my food again. This time it's roasted pork belly with steamed vegetables. Good it was too!
item.dc:creator: Charles Dixon

item.title: Day 32 - Photo a Day
item.description: Today, for some unknown reason, I decided to ride my road bike. I was quite bored by the time I got to the end of Bow Street and very nearly just went to Borth and back but I wanted to check out the climb from Talybont to Anglers. The climb …
item.dc:creator: Charles Dixon

item.title: Day 31 - Photo a Day
item.description: Hurrah I've managed a whole month of photos! Today I went for a shortish ride up Nant, just toboggan and then over to the main trails and did a Pendam loop. First ride on the 44s and, wow, they're properly nice. Had to back the rebound off a touch as …
item.dc:creator: Charles Dixon

item.title: Day 30 - Photo a Day
item.description: Unfortunately today I'm feeling totally washed out, don't know why. I only just remembered to take a photo so it's the delightful view from my bed, you best feel privileged.
item.dc:creator: Charles Dixon

item.title: Day 29 - Photo a Day
item.description: Today I finished hanging bits off of the new frame. I've had to bodge the front brake a bit as my mount is 200mm and rotor is 203 so washers were required. Looking forward to riding it now.
item.dc:creator: Charles Dixon

item.title: Day 28 - Photo a Day
item.description: Christmas Eve I had a stack in the Dyfi and whilst correcting my bars Andy noticed that my bottom headset cup was very loose, most likely borked frame. Turns out that Stu, his brother, had an identical frame that I could buy... Whilst at it Andy could sell me his …
item.dc:creator: Charles Dixon

item.title: Day 27 - Photo a Day
item.description:
Generally speaking I'm against taking photos of my food but I really wanted to share this one. It's a thai red curry and it's, frankly, just bloody amazing. It's really easy to make, tastes great and the ingredients aren't ridiculously hard to get hold of.The recipe is here.

[Album …
item.dc:creator: Charles Dixon

item.title: Day 26 - Photo a Day
item.description: This morning I went for a ride round Nant with Bean, bit of a spin down after the winter warmup. I had a job interview in the afternoon so I didn't want to ride anything too wild! Got offered the job just for reference :). We did a standard YstwythMTB loop …
item.dc:creator: Charles Dixon

item.title: Day 25 - Photo a Day
item.description: Today was the Dyfi Winter Warmup. We left around 9:30 to give Taylor time to try buy a ticket, luckily he was able to. We got there around 10:30 and signed on then we started riding at around 11. It was a rad event and we managed 2 …
item.dc:creator: Charles Dixon

item.title: Day 24 - Photo a Day
item.description: It's Dyfi winter warmup weekend! Today I picked up Zop from the station and cracked on up to Nant to meet up with Andy and Taylor, although Andy isn't actually riding tomorrow. Turns out that Taylor also doesn't have a ticket, skills. He's going to try talk nicely to the …
item.dc:creator: Charles Dixon

item.title: Day 23 - Photo a Day
item.description: This Sunday coming is the Dyfi Winter Warmup. I have people staying with me this weekend as there are a few of us riding the event. Also a small group of us going to riding Nant tomorrow. I have Taylor and Dan staying with me tomorrow night and Dan n …
item.dc:creator: Charles Dixon

item.title: Day 22 - Photo a Day
item.description: I'm on a role with these thoroughly uninteresting photos, but I've had some things on my mind of late so hopefully I'll pick it all back up come this weekend! Today is half of a falafel burger, which I what I had for my evening meal - falafel burgers, chips n …
item.dc:creator: Charles Dixon

item.title: Day 21 - Photo a Day
item.description:
Another day in the office, followed by a 4 hour drive in the dark. At least I'm now home but it's another uninspired photo! This one of the doors to the office.

Album link
item.dc:creator: Charles Dixon

item.title: Day 20 - Photo a Day
item.description: Being away from home and spending all of my time in the office or where I'm staying is making a photo a bit more difficult. Today we have a photo of my Toshiba Chromebook. It's a good little machine. Boots fast and I like ChromeOS. Aside from the trackpad it …
item.dc:creator: Charles Dixon

item.title: Day 19 - Photo a Day
item.description: My new boss is flying over from the US and will be in the office tomorrow so I decided I'd better be in the office. I left straight after work and got to where I'm staying (with a guy from work) around 21:30. This photo is of the room …
item.dc:creator: Charles Dixon

item.title: Day 5 - Photo a Day
item.description: First day back at work this year and, as expected, first day when I've been a little lost what to photo. I'm still keen to not just take photos or random stuff and want things that I can write a bit of something about. So today is an indiscriminate bottle …
item.dc:creator: Charles Dixon

item.title: Day 4 - Photo a Day
item.description: Today I was due to ride the Red Kite Frozen Devil but I made a call yesterday that I was going to have to bail due to my cold. I arranged to do a bit of nant ride with Andy as he was over this way surfing this morning. I …
item.dc:creator: Charles Dixon

item.title: Day 3 - Photo a Day
item.description: Still ill. Luckily, my first The Spicery box arrived today. I got given a subscription for xmas from my family. The idea is that each month you get sent a box with the spices for a meal, you buy the remaining ingredients and make the meal. There's a choice of …
item.dc:creator: Charles Dixon

item.title: Day 2 - Photo a Day
item.description: Following on yesterday's photo, today I had a bit of a garage sort out. Almost everything on the left through the door (not the lawnmower!) is for the tip. Should be loads of room once all of that stuff is gone :).
item.dc:creator: Charles Dixon

item.title: Day 1 - Photo a Day
item.description:
A new year has rolled around and once again I've decided to attempt a photo a day. I strongly suspect that before January ends that I'll be doing a photo a week but hopefully this'll drive me to get out more and do some interesting things.

So, day 1. I'm …
item.dc:creator: Charles Dixon

item.title: Changing Platform
item.description: I write posts somewhat sporadically and I'm quite good at forgetting how my pelican setup works. For this reason I decided to change the technology behind my blog. Moving away from using pelican and hosting on github pages to Postachio. Postachio is a blogging platform that ties into a handful …
item.dc:creator: Charles Dixon
